meanings.definition: Not equal in quantity, size, or value.
meanings.sent1: The two sides of the scale were unequal in weight.
meanings.sent2: The unequal distribution of resources led to tension among the group.
meanings.sent3: The unequal slices of cake caused a playful argument at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting was unequal, surpassing all her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The unequal partnership between the two companies eventually led to a breakup.

meanings.definition: Not having the same abilities or opportunities as others.
meanings.sent1: The students with unequal skills struggled to keep up with the class.
meanings.sent2: She felt the unequal treatment at work was unfair.
meanings.sent3: The unequal race between the tortoise and the hare was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His unequalled determination to succeed inspired everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The unequal access to education highlighted the need for change in the system.
